critique: The document primarily focuses on the internal organization and membership of the Board of Foreign Service Personnel and the Board of Examiners for the Foreign Service. It outlines the roles of officers from the Departments of Commerce and Agriculture within these boards and amends previous executive orders to reflect these changes. There is no discussion of immigration, civil liberties, or social issues. The document seems neutral regarding ideological tilt, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation and social inclusion.
